title: Install generated 64×64 PNG favicon and wire it in index.html

requirements.summary: Add the generated 64×64 PNG favicon to frontend public assets and serve it at a stable URL.
acceptanceCriteria: The repository contains the file favicon-64.png under frontend/public (preferred: frontend/public/assets/generated/favicon-64.png).
When the app is running, requesting the favicon URL returns a 200 and the content-type is image/png.

file_operations.description: Add the already-generated 64×64 PNG favicon asset so it is served statically at a stable URL (/assets/generated/favicon-64.png).

requirements.summary: Update the HTML entry point to reference the PNG favicon instead of /favicon.ico.
acceptanceCriteria: frontend/index.html includes a <link rel="icon"> tag pointing to the PNG favicon URL (e.g., /assets/generated/favicon-64.png) and uses type="image/png".
The previous /favicon.ico reference is removed or superseded such that modern browsers display the PNG favicon in the tab.

file_operations.description: Replace the existing /favicon.ico <link rel="icon"> tag with a PNG favicon link referencing /assets/generated/favicon-64.png and type="image/png" (optionally include sizes="64x64"). Ensure the .ico reference is removed or clearly superseded.

requirements.summary: Add a repeatable verification procedure for favicon rendering in dev and production builds.
acceptanceCriteria: In local dev (vite) the browser tab displays the generated favicon.
After building and serving the production assets, the browser tab displays the generated favicon.

file_operations.description: Document a simple, repeatable manual verification checklist for favicon rendering in both local dev (vite) and production build serving, including the exact URL to request (/assets/generated/favicon-64.png) and expected content-type (image/png).
Add or update a convenient script for previewing/serving the production build (if not already present) so the production favicon check can be performed consistently.
